definition: to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: Her husband died suddenly, leaving her with five children.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫突然故去，給她留下了五個孩子。

sentences.english: I aleasysty understanding since the head nurse these Connie get died at 11 A.
sentences.chinese: 長已經告訴我，康尼在早上11點故去了。

sentences.english: I already knew from the head nurse that Connie had died at 11 A.M..
sentences.chinese: 護士長已經告訴我，康尼在上午11點故去了。

sentences.english: His first wife passed away in 2004.
sentences.chinese: 他的第一房夫人在2004年故去了。

sentences.english: She wants to switch the name to honor her son's deceased grandfather.
sentences.chinese: 她想換一下這個名字，以紀念孩子故去的爺爺。

sentences.english: Mom died five days after her 53rd birthday.
sentences.chinese: 她53歲生日過後5天故去了。

sentences.english: I lost my father two years ago.
The good vs. evil battle will continue, even without Jobs.
sentences.chinese: 正邪之爭仍將延續，就算喬布斯故去後也依然會如此。

sentences.english: I would rather suffer in your arms than die without you.
sentences.chinese: 我寧願在你的懷抱受盡折磨也不願離你故去。

sentences.english: Have a smoke and look to the vast sky to console the departed.
sentences.chinese: 吸口靈煙，望長空慰祭故去之人。

definition: to die/to depart this mortal coil
to die/to depart this life (euphemism)/same as 去世
lit. to fly on a crane to the Western Paradise/fig. to pass away (idiom)
to become an immortal/(fig.) to die
